intro: Hieracium nigrellum, commonly known as black hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Hieracium nigrellum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through its rhizomes.
